byline.contributor: Rick Rojas reported from Pocono Summit, and Benjamin Mueller from New York. Elizabeth A. Harris, Nate Schweber and Jeffrey E. Singer contributed reporting from New York, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Grand jury report on death of Baruch College freshman Chun Hsien Deng during December 2013 hazing ritual in Pennsylvania finds Deng angered fraternity brothers by fighting back; describes hazing ritual in detail; prosecutors say they will charge five people involved with third-degree murder and 32 others with variety of other counts.
lead_paragraph: During a ritual called the Glass Ceiling, in which Pi Delta Psi brothers tackle pledges, Chun Hsien Deng was hit harder after he did not fall in line, a grand jury report says.

headline.main: Defiant Baruch Fraternity Pledge Fought Back in Fatal Hazing, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Defiant Pledge Fought Back in Fatal Hazing, Report Says

snippet: During a ritual called the Glass Ceiling, in which Pi Delta Psi brothers tackle pledges, Chun Hsien Deng was hit harder after he did not fall in line, a grand jury report says.
